definition: to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to accuse falsely
pitfall/trap/to get stuck/to sink/to cave in/to frame (false charge)/to capture (a city in battle)/to fall (to the enemy)/defect
unjust accusation/miscarriage of justice

sentences.english: I can sue you for slander.
sentences.chinese: 我可以控告你进行诬陷。

sentences.english: Lokting awake after crying in some words to frame Aileen Jun.
sentences.chinese: 乐婷清醒后哭着对家骏说些陷诬陷艾琳的话。

sentences.english: The state-run China Daily headlined: "False charges deter lending elderly hand."
sentences.chinese: 国营的中国日报标题说“诬陷之舌挡住了援助之手”。

sentences.english: He said he was framed by his ex-wife.
sentences.chinese: 他说他受到了前妻的诬陷。

sentences.english: He has falsely accused Mr Darcy, and has lied wickedly about the whole Darcy family.
sentences.chinese: 他诬陷达西先生，还恶毒地编造有关达西全家的谎言。

sentences.english: He believes Zarek was falsely imprisoned.
sentences.chinese: 他认为查莱克是被诬陷入狱的。

sentences.english: During the Thrawn crisis, Imperial Intelligence agents framed Ackbar for an embezzlement scheme.
sentences.chinese: 在索龙危机期间，帝国情报人员诬陷阿克巴贪污。
单纯的真理被诬陷为呆傻。

sentences.english: The state-run China Daily headlined: “False charges deter lending elderly hand.
sentences.chinese: 国营的中国日报标题说“诬陷之舌挡住了援助之手”。

sentences.english: Framed BaoGuMing molested her strange flower, is simple BaoGuMing decided to resign.
sentences.chinese: 奇葩诬陷鲍家明非礼她，鲍家明决定辞职。

sentences.english: He was innocent and the victim of a frame-up.
sentences.chinese: 他是清白的，是受人诬陷的。

sentences.english: And, when he mentioned his reflection on the facts of his crime, he was actually revealing and rebuking the calumniators .
sentences.chinese: 说到他对罪状的反思，实际是对诬陷者的揭落与斥责。

sentences.english: If you like you can tell that to the people who are slandering you.
sentences.chinese: 你可以直接引用我的话，去告诉诬陷你的人。

sentences.english: Do not you see it was all a frame-up !
sentences.chinese: 难道你还不明白那都是诬陷。

to frame sb/to accuse falsely
to frame/to bring false charges against
to slander/to smear/to tarnish

to lodge an accusation/accusation (law)

to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to shield/to harbor/to cover up
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
